results.title: All change please
results.brief_description:
A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Against the Grain” in association with Partners in Grain (PING).
“All change please. That’s what they say when the train is at the last station.” Diana Anderson began her journey around 23 years ago when she moved on to her husband’s family farm in north-west Victoria. Worked on for generations, Diana and Choco improved and changed the farming business, raising their two boys and enjoying the life for almost 23 years. That is until they were confronted with the distressing news the family partnership was to be sold. For Diana this was the end of one journey and the start of another - a new beginning.

group.title: Against the grain: digital storytelling project

results.title: Sustainability
results.brief_description:
A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Against the Grain” in association with Partners in Grain (PING).
Althea Hunt describes her life as a farmer’s wife from leaving her beloved family in Queensland to joining her husband and running their independent cereal farm in the Millewa district of Victoria. She talks of the enormous changes - the hard work and dealing with the often unrelenting climate of drought and cyclones whilst also raising three young children and maintaining the family unit. For Althea however, it has been exciting and rewarding to see how far their farm has come over the 30 year journey since she left Queensland.

group.title: Against the grain: digital storytelling project

results.title: Extending boundaries
results.brief_description:
A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Against the Grain” in association with Partners in Grain (PING).
Merna Curnow, raised on a farm, always wanted to be a teacher. She never considered herself as a farmer, not even when she married a third generation farmer of the Curnow family. Teacher, mother and supportive wife until one day she suffered an identity crisis when helping her husband out on the farm. That day became a turning point in Merna’s life.

results.title: Ron's story
results.brief_description: A wife remembers her wonderful life with her husband, who can now no longer remember it with her. Created as part of the ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ workshop, an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with Alzheimer’s Australia Vic and in partnership with VicHealth.

results.title: A different perspective
results.brief_description: ‘I was given a photo pass to the 1994 Big Day Out. From then on, outside my day job I worked as a freelance photographer’. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’.
